paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: the two which are responsible for the majority of disease-causing hATTR cardiac amyloidosis in the UK and Ireland are the V142I (formerly V122I) and T80A (formerly T60A) variants
the two which are responsible for the majority of disease-causing hATTR cardiac amyloidosis in the UK and Ireland are the V142I (formerly V122I) and T80A (formerly T60A) variants

functional_data.summary: The V142I and T80A variants are known to be pathogenic and associated with hATTR cardiac amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, these variants segregate with disease in families.
variants.source_location: Main Text, Overview of cardiac amyloidosis
variants.additional_notes: Variants V142I and T80A are the most common in the UK and Ireland.
key_quotes: the two which are responsible for the majority of disease-causing hATTR cardiac amyloidosis in the UK and Ireland are the V142I (formerly V122I) and T80A (formerly T60A) variants

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
